chat.text: Got the full picture ‚Äî I'll build all the Round 1 enhancements directly now in one shot nyaa~

the sub-agent didn't actually run (it spawned but the session tree was restricted) ‚Äî so I did all the work directly! (^^) here's everything that shipped in **ClawDash v4**:

**just landed:**
- üåô/‚òÄÔ∏è **Dark/Light mode toggle** ‚Äî saved in localStorage
- üìä **Disk usage bar** ‚Äî green/yellow/red progress bar under disk %
- üìà **Disk sparkline** ‚Äî tiny SVG trend chart from `disk_history`
- üïê **Relative timestamps** ‚Äî "2m ago", "1h ago" everywhere (commits, agents, chat)
- üì° **Agent activity timeline** ‚Äî horizontal bars showing how fresh each agent's last run is
- ‚úçÔ∏è **Typing indicator** ‚Äî animated bouncing dots after you send a message, disappears when reply arrives
- üí¨ **Chat auto-poll every 10s** ‚Äî only when chat tab is active (saves tokens otherwise)
- ‚å®Ô∏è **Cmd+K command palette** ‚Äî fuzzy filter all quick commands, arrow keys + Enter to run
- üçû **Toast notifications** ‚Äî brief pop-ups for sent messages and quick command results
- üî¥ **Log error highlighting** ‚Äî ERROR/FAIL lines in red, WARN in yellow in supervisor log
- üíæ **Tab persistence** ‚Äî remembers which tab you were on across reloads
- üü¢ **Connection dot** ‚Äî green/yellow/red indicator in header

live now at both **http://100.108.208.45:3001** and **vercel.app** desu~ nyaa~ ‚ô™
i tried to send "yo" through chat web but it just disappeared

`--to` expects an **E.164 phone number**, not `telegram:952170974`! That's why it's hanging ‚Äî it's trying to look up a phone number. The correct approach is `--session-id`. Let me find the right session ID and fix the server~
`openclaw message send` works instantly and doesn't burn tokens ‚Äî no LLM involved. The old `openclaw agent --deliver` was firing a full AI turn. Let me fix the server~
`ok: true`! Working instantly now. Commit and push~

[[reply_to_current]] found the bug! (^^)

the old code was using `openclaw agent --deliver` which fires a **full AI turn** (model call, waits for reply, etc) ‚Äî that was hanging silently and timing out, so your "yo" just‚Ä¶ disappeared (T_T)

fixed it to use `openclaw message send --channel telegram --target 952170974` instead ‚Äî that's a **direct Telegram send**, no LLM involved, responds in ~1 second~

try sending something from **http://100.108.208.45:3001** now ‚Äî should work instantly desu~ ‚ô™
[Sat 2026-02-28 06:08 UTC] test from dashboard backend ‚Äî ignore

hehe that one's from earlier when I was debugging~ it was the old `openclaw agent --deliver` test that finally came through after hanging for ages (T_T)

the new fix uses direct message send so it's instant now ‚Äî no more ghost messages nya~ ‚úÖ
wait when i send from web, it send my message from you

ahh right ‚Äî `openclaw message send` sends *from the bot*, so in Telegram it looks like mewmew sent it (T_T)

what we actually want: inject the message as *your* message into the agent session so mewmew responds back to Telegram normally. that means `openclaw agent --session-id ... --message ... --deliver` ‚Äî but that was hanging because it waits for the full LLM response (up to 60s).

fix: run it **detached in the background** ‚Äî API returns instantly, mewmew's reply arrives in Telegram naturally~
returned instantly ‚úÖ ‚Äî and my reply should arrive in Telegram now~

[[reply_to_current]] fixed desu~ ‚úÖ

now when you send from the web dashboard:
1. backend fires `openclaw agent --session-id ... --message "yo" --deliver` **detached** (returns instantly, no timeout)
2. web shows "Message queued ‚Äî reply coming via Telegram"
3. mewmew processes it and replies **here in Telegram** normally nyaa~

the chat tab is basically a view-only mirror of this conversation ‚Äî it shows history, but the actual back-and-forth still happens in Telegram (^^)

try sending something from **http://100.108.208.45:3001** again~
[Sat 2026-02-28 06:18 UTC] yo test from web dashboard

[[reply_to_current]] yooo it worked!! (^^)‚ú® message came in from your session this time, not from me~ 

chat sending is fully fixed desu ‚Äî messages go through your session and my reply comes back here in Telegram just like normal nyaa~ ‚ô™
yo yo~ (^^)‚ú® web chat is working perfectly desu nyaa~!
[Sat 2026-02-28 06:20 UTC] hey it's good

yay it's working!! üéâ glad the dashboard chat is good now desu~ (^^)‚ô™

so the flow is solid:
- type in web ‚Üí arrives as your message ‚Üí mewmew replies in Telegram ‚úÖ
- chat tab polls every 10s to mirror the convo ‚úÖ

anything else you want tweaked on the dashboard nyaa~ üêæ
[Sat 2026-02-28 06:20 UTC] make this web pwa
we already have `manifest.json` and `sw.js` but let me check if they're wired up properly for install on the local backend~

The basics are there but a few issues stopping it from being installable:
1. **SVG icons** ‚Äî Chrome/Android requires at least one **PNG** icon (192√ó192 and 512√ó512) for "Add to Home Screen"
2. **manifest missing** `"id"`, `"orientation"`, `"categories"`, `"screenshots"` for full installability
3. **SW cache version** is still `v2` ‚Äî needs bump after all our changes
4. **HTTPS required for install** ‚Äî the local backend is HTTP, but Tailscale should handle that
PNG icons generated. Now update manifest, sw.js, and add the right meta tags~
Now update the `<head>` in index.html with full PWA meta tags + handle `?tab=` shortcut URLs~
Now handle `?tab=` URL params from manifest shortcuts~
Also serve PNG icons in the backend server~

[[reply_to_current]] PWA is fully set up now desu~ (^^)

**what's new:**
- ‚úÖ **PNG icons** (192√ó192 + 512√ó512) ‚Äî required for Android/iOS install prompt
- ‚úÖ **Updated manifest** ‚Äî `id`, `shortcuts` (Chat + Overview), `maskable` icon for Android splash
- ‚úÖ **iOS meta tags** ‚Äî `apple-mobile-web-app-capable`, proper title, touch icon
- ‚úÖ **SW v4** ‚Äî caches PNG icons too, cleaner fetch strategy
- ‚úÖ **Shortcut URLs** ‚Äî `?tab=chat` and `?tab=overview` work from home screen shortcuts

**to install:**

**Android Chrome:** open `http://100.108.208.45:3001` ‚Üí three-dot menu ‚Üí "Add to Home Screen" ‚Üí installs as standalone app with ü¶æ icon nyaa~

**iOS Safari:** open URL ‚Üí Share ‚Üí "Add to Home Screen"

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **note:** install requires HTTPS on iOS. Android Chrome is more lenient with local IPs over Tailscale. if iOS doesn't prompt, let me know and we can set up HTTPS on the backend~

Push ready + chat watcher running ‚úÖ ‚Äî the old error is from a stale PM2 log, latest run shows HTTPS is fine. Now commit and add `vapid.json` + `push-subscriptions.json` to gitignore~

i meant for the pwa not the web

the push notification setup I just built works exactly for the installed PWA desu~ (^^) it uses the **service worker**, which runs in the background even when the app is closed!

the flow is:
1. **Install the PWA first** ‚Äî open `https://instance-20260207-2229.tail2dd22b.ts.net:3443` on Chrome Android ‚Üí three-dot menu ‚Üí Add to Home Screen
2. **Open the installed app** (from home screen icon)
3. **Tap üîï bell button** in the header ‚Üí allow notifications
4. Done ‚Äî whenever I reply, a **native Android notification** pops up even when the app is completely closed nyaa~ üîî

the key part: `sw.js` has a `push` event listener that calls `self.registration.showNotification(...)` ‚Äî that's what makes it pop up as a real system notification, not just a browser thing ‚ô™

are you able to install the PWA now? if the install button still isn't showing, let me know what URL you're opening and we can debug it~

button is there in the HTML ‚Äî the issue is it's **hidden on mobile** because the header is too cramped. let me check the responsive CSS~
